intro: Thymus × monrealensis nothosubsp. peris-gisbertii, commonly known as the Peris-Gisbert thyme, is a hybrid plant belonging to the Lamiaceae family. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and aromatic, small, grey-green leaves. The plant produces clusters of pink to purple flowers, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. Due to its ornamental value and unique genetic background, it is a subject of interest in botanical research and horticulture.
